Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.MatterName: Increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disallowing, for purposes of the city general corporation tax, banking corporation tax and unincorporated business income tax, certain additional accelerated depreciation deductions with respect to certain property acquired after September 10, 2001, allowed by the amendments to the internal revenue code made by section 101 of public law 107-147.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.MatterName: Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the rate of tax on cigarettes.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rate of tax on cigarettes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the rate of tax on cigarettes.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rate of tax on cigarettes.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to provision of a temporary retirement incentive for certain employees of the city of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.MinutesNote: Preconsidered; Passed with Message of Necessity
Items.MatterName: Temporary retirement incentive for certain employees of the city of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for Fiscal Year 2003.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for FY'03.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel is more than $2,750 or where, irrespective of the annual tax, the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and for non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health.
Items.MatterName: Orders of the Board of Health or Dept of Health, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel, other than a parcel that consists of vacant or unimproved land, is not more than $2,750, be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2003 in the case of any such parcel where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent; and 9% per annum in the case of all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Vacant or unimproved land, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for any parcel where the annual real estate tax is more than $2,750 or where the real estate taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent or where the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and 9% per annum in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Water and Sewer Rents, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Resolution computing and certifying base percentage, current percentage and current base proportion of each class of real property for Fiscal 2003 to the State Board of Real Property Services pursuant to Section 1803-a, Real Property Tax Law.
Items.MatterName: Computing and certifying base percentage, current percentage and current base proportion of each class of real property for FY'03 to the State Board of Real Property Services.

Items.Title: Resolution computing and certifying adjusted base proportion of each class of Real Property for Fiscal 2003 to the State Board of Real Property Services pursuant to Section 1803-a, Real Property Tax Law.
Items.MatterName: Computing and certifying adjusted base proportion of each class of Real Property for FY'03 to the State Board of Real Property Services.

Items.Title: RESOLUTION TO ADOPT A BUDGET APPROPRIATING THE AMOUNTS NECESSARY FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK AND THE COUNTIES THEREIN AND FOR THE PAYMENT OF INDEBTEDNESS THEREOF, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR BEGINNING ON JULY 1, 2002 AND ENDING ON JUNE 30, 2003 IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE CHARTER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
Items.MatterName: Expense Revenue Contract, FY 2003

Items.Title: RESOLUTION TO ADOPT A CONTRACT BUDGET SETTING FORTH, BY AGENCY, CATEGORIES OF CONTRACTUAL SERVICES FOR WHICH APPROPRIATIONS HAD BEEN PROPOSED FOR THE FISCAL YEAR BEGINNING ON JULY 1, 2002 AND ENDING ON JUNE 30, 2003, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE CHARTER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
Items.MatterName: Expense Revenue Contract, FY 2003

Items.Title: RESOLUTION BY THE NEW YORK CITY COUNCIL PURSUANT TO SECTION 254 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, THAT THE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2003 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM, BEING THE EXECUTIVE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2003 AND PROGRAM AS SUBMITTED BY THE MAYOR ON APRIL 17, 2002, AND BY THE BOROUGH PRESIDENTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 249 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, INCLUDING RESCINDMENT OF AMOUNTS FROM PRIOR CAPITAL BUDGETS, BE AND THE SAME ARE HEREBY APPROVED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE OF CHANGES. (RESOLUTION A)
Items.MatterName: Executive Capital Budget, FY 2003 (Resolution A)

Items.Title: RESOLUTION BY THE NEW YORK CITY COUNCIL PURSUANT TO SECTION 254 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, THAT THE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2003 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM FOR THE ENSUING THREE YEARS, AS SET FORTH IN THE EXECUTIVE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2003 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM AS SUBMITTED BY THE MAYOR ON APRIL 17, 2002, AS AUGMENTED BY THE BOROUGH PRESIDENTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 249 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, AND AMENDED BY THE SCHEDULE OF CHANGES APPROVED UNDER RESOLUTION A, INCLUDING AMOUNTS REALLOCATED BY THE RESCINDMENT OF AMOUNTS FROM PRIOR CAPITAL BUDGET APPROPRIATIONS, IS HEREBY ADOPTED IN THE TOTAL AMOUNTS AS FOLLOWS. (RESOLUTION B)
Items.MatterName: Executive Capital Budget, FY 2003 (Resolution B)

Items.Title: RESOLUTION APPROVING THE FISCAL YEAR 2003 COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM, REALLOCATION OF TWENTY-EIGHTH YEAR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FUNDS, AND THE PROPOSED TWENTY-NINTH YEAR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM.
Items.MatterName: Proposed City FY 2003 Community Development Program

Items.Title: RESOLUTION CONCURRING IN A COMMUNICATION FROM THE MAYOR TRANSMITTING THE CERTIFICATE SETTING FORTH THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF DEBT & RESERVES WHICH THE CITY, THE NYC TRANSITIONAL FINANCE AUTHORITY, THE NYC MUNICIPAL WATER FINANCE AUTHORITY, THE NYS DORMITORY AUTHORITY & THE NYC HEALTH & HOSPITALS CORPORATION MAY SOUNDLY INCUR FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2003 & THE ENSUING THREE FISCAL YEARS, & THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF APPROPRIATIONS & EXPENDITURES FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS WHICH MAY SOUNDLY BE MADE DURING EACH FISCAL YEAR, PURSUANT TO SECTION 250 (16) OF THE NY CITY CHARTER.
Items.MatterName: Certificate setting the maximum amount of debt and reserves.

Items.Title: Resolution to provide the amounts necessary for the support of the Government of the City of New York and the counties therein and for the payment of indebtedness thereof, for the Fiscal Year beginning on July 1, 2002 and ending on June 30, 2003 by the levy of taxes on the Real Property in the City of New York, in accordance with the provisions of the constitution of the State of New York, the Real Property Tax Law and the Charter of the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Resolution of the Council of the City of New York fixing the tax rate for the FY'03.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2003, pursuant to Section 1519 of the City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for FY'03.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750, or vacant or unimproved land; and non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health be 18 percent (18%) for Fiscal Year 2003.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750 (18%) for FY'03.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting resolution recommending that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 or where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid by a mortgage escrow agent be eighteen percent (18%), and nine percent (9%) in all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 (18%) & (9%).

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750 or where taxes are held in escrow or where parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land, and nine percent (9%) in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for FY'03 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750.
